{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, the types of oral candidiasis that can present with white patches include acute pseudomembranous candidiasis, chronic hyperplastic candidiasis, and chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis. Pseudomembranous candidiasis is specifically mentioned as the most common type of oral candidiasis and is characterized by extensive white patches that can be easily removed with gauze, leaving an erythematous mucosa surface. Therefore, the type of oral candidiasis that does not present with white patches is chronic atrophic candidiasis.", "answer_choice": "A"}
